answers.answer: Hello,Burning sensation and pain are characteristic of a nerve injury. It can be due to metabolic disorders like diabetes, hypothyroidism, and hypoparathyroidismThey can also be due to peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the tingling is gone or not.In case the symptoms persist then please consult a neurologist as it can be due to some neurological disorder.  I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing. Warm regards.

question: I've been experiencing intermittently a severe burning sensation on my right inner forearm, it can last one to three days and then it is gone for a few weeks/months and then it comes back. When I touch the area slightly it is truly painful. Any reasons for this occurrence?
title: inner forearm burning sensation/pain
